He sounds like a husband that says he‚Äôs ‚Äúbabysitting‚Äù his own kids when he talks to other adults. 

But yeah, him being a teacher makes his comments much more horrific. I suggest you sit down and talk with him about these things. Like an actual no kids talk about it. If the slurs continue, I‚Äôd honestly email his principal about these problems. Slurs in any capacity are unacceptable, but the fact that he teaches young impressionable people makes it more so.

It was hard. We had to put Haley down in November. She had a nerve disease that slowly took her over. I‚Äôm her last couple weeks we had to carry her everywhere, even outside to go to the bathroom. 

My mom (who raised her on a dropper from a couple days old), dad, and I all were there. It was sad. I saw her the whole time still in there, but she was getting wounds that wouldn‚Äôt heal and she couldn‚Äôt walk. It wasn‚Äôt good to keep her alive for us. We were there and we brought her home and buried her in a special place. 

It was hard to not see her around the house. I swear I saw her on her pillow a couple days after her death. It‚Äôs still hard. We talk about her. Like we picked up some sticks in the front yard before mowing the other day. She used to come out with us and grab a stick of her own. Her sticks are still by the front door. We got one we knew she‚Äôd like and put it on her grave. I cried over her that day. That was the first time in a while. I‚Äôm crying now just writing this. I‚Äôll always miss her attitude and the noises she‚Äôs make. I‚Äôll miss how fluffy she was and how she stuck to mom like glue because mom raised her. 

It gets easier with time. You find things that remind you of them and hold them close. It will be okay, but you have to give yourself some time.
Ah okay lol. It‚Äôs morning for me lol. That‚Äôs got to be a lot of practice. But yeah, giddy sounds like a good word

Does your landlord know that your parents pay your rent and bills? If not, I‚Äôd suggest when you get them to do a ‚Äúrandom check‚Äù you tell them the situation of why they are here and how your parents are forcing you to keep her there. 

Also, if you are uncomfortable waiting on the landlord or the landlord won‚Äôt come for a while, I would call the police. Make sure you give a solid timeline of everything happening. She had made many small advancements that could escalate. 

Please keep yourself at a good distance from her and let us know what happens

Thank you. I have actually already breached the subject and we did end up ending our relationship. I saw my (now ex) girlfriend at work last Monday and she told me that they both still love me and they‚Äôre only a phone call away. I was really worried about being a disappointment in a way. 

It took him a day (not really that long actually; I texted in the afternoon and he responded the next morning) to respond. Apparently there were other personal things going on. He understood and told me I was a very good sub for my time with them.

Before I begin: YTA ... big time. Like Evil Step-Witch/Step-Monster level. (Your stepdaughter can determine the title)

1. Your fianc√©‚Äôs ‚Äúex wife‚Äù is his WIDOW. SHE IS DEAD. It‚Äôs really strange how you look at her like some kind of competition. Get over yourself 

2. A wedding is about joining two families TOGETHER. That means that his daughter is now yours. 

3. That kid is grieving. She lost her mom only two years ago. She was 13! Imagine going through middle and high school and your mom dies. She‚Äôs  going through a rough time. You‚Äôre making it worse. 

I feel like you‚Äôre looking at this poem the wrong way. She‚Äôs trying to wish you both well by saying that she hopes that you both have the fairytale that she say her parents have BEFORE HER MOM DIED. 

I‚Äôm going to reiterate something I said earlier because you really need to hear it.

Get. Over. Yourself.

But if you were butting in and making excuses instead of letting your child speak, then nothing will get resolved. Doctors will usually bring the parents in to an appointment at the end after talking to talk about their findings. It doesn‚Äôt mean you won‚Äôt know what‚Äôs going on, it just gives the kid the ability to talk freely about things.

The reason they were asking is probably because they knew that it was going to be rescheduled to your place of work and she didn‚Äôt want any embarrassment. 

A munch is a non sexual BDSM public event. Mostly used to make friends and connections in a vanilla way. That‚Äôs how I describe it anyway. It‚Äôs nothing to be embarrassed about. 

I would let her come to you when she‚Äôs ready OP. She can explore things if she feels like it. There shouldn‚Äôt be any shame attached to it.

I have a few rules in my relationship. We are polyamorous (Daddy is married to his other sub, and I‚Äôm semi submissive to them as well, but most of my rules are between Him and i). I can send you some of them if you‚Äôd like.

The thing is, when she realized how upset you were, she should have stopped right then and apologized. She MADE the conscious decision to keep it going. She could‚Äôve stopped it at any time. 

She needs to accept responsibility. How would she feel if you called her playing this on her? And then when she got home and saw her child was alive and everyone told her she was overreacting?

They have the right to not disclose that legal information online if they so choose. They answered a question you asked, but declined to give that one tidbit of personal information. They seem to be answering questions adequately. 

But also you saying that you are surprised that they aren‚Äôt locked away is really rude. Why do you think that this person should be locked away? Is it only YOUR experiences of biases of the disorders they are diagnosed with?

This is one reason I‚Äôm on the fence about having kids. My dad has a genetic disorder that I (19F) received and my mom has another that I could possibly have (pretty sure I‚Äôm okay right now).

I know that if I had a kid I would be so worried about them having to deal with what I (or my parents) have dealt with. I know that it‚Äôs not too hard to manage with the right medication and diet, but still I don‚Äôt want someone to be stuck with something because I was selfish and wanted a child.

She violated HIPPA, she should‚Äôve been trained on these laws before being allowed to work. It doesn‚Äôt matter if it‚Äôs your own family member or your best friend. IT IS CONFIDENTIAL. 

She should‚Äôve been reported so that she learns that she is not the one to make those decisions and it doesn‚Äôt matter if it‚Äôs a family member or not. 

Edited to add:

You are NTA, but I think she needs to be reported so she doesn‚Äôt breach confidentiality for anyone else. You have no idea if she‚Äôs done this about anyone else in the unit.

You also do not need to hesitate to go back to the unit if you are unwell. And this might make you hesitate. 

I hope you‚Äôre doing a lot better.

Update:

Haley hasn‚Äôt passed yet. We tried a new steroid, but she still hasn‚Äôt been able to get up and walk. Her hair is falling out pretty fast. She‚Äôs not in pain or anything luckily. Her attitude is still the same as before she got bad. We are taking her outside and getting her to go to the bathroom. We bring her water frequently. We have been loving on her all the time. 

We‚Äôre taking her to the vet tomorrow. We agreed to do what the vet says tomorrow. My parents and I are accepting the fact that we might have to put her down tomorrow. She‚Äôs just not seeming to be getting better.

I don‚Äôt really know what judgement to give but I have a comment. 

Have you tried to call her? I wasn‚Äôt sure if y‚Äôall had. I‚Äôm currently in my second year of college. It is stressful. College in general is stressful. She probably really appreciates the support but she‚Äôs one of a few things: stressed, overwhelmed, or depressed.  Not responding for three months is not normal and needs to be investigated. 

When I get as going through a bad episode with my depression, I didn‚Äôt get out of bed but to go to class, I read messages but I send like one word replies to keep my family happy (I definitely stressed/ still do stress about keeping my family happy because they do pay for my college). 

We know you guys are worried, but she‚Äôs probably stressing about a ton of things at once while being out of state in college (aka she‚Äôs a good bit away from her family).

At some colleges there is s crisis hotline for someone to anonymously report a student and give them a welfare check. At the school I attend, the mental health care team meets with the student and makes sure they‚Äôre safe and gets them the health they need. They won‚Äôt necessarily report back to you, but they will help make sure your child is safe and okay. And that‚Äôs what matters

This is definitely not normal. This sounds very toxic. Using your own issues and flipping them  back on something for no reason is absolutely crazy. Also, the fact that she doesn‚Äôt want to listen to anything you say and then threaten to end the relationship if you don‚Äôt comply is more than toxic. It would probably be best to re-evaluate the relationship due to someone wanting to ending the relationship. 

I hope this is not too personal, but I worry. Has she gotten physical with this rage? Even if she wasn‚Äôt, her behavior so far is completely unacceptable. 

I hope everyone has been giving good advice and giving you a new perspective.

I‚Äôm 19 (and CF of course) with depression, anxiety, possible sleep apnea and an unsteady thyroid that doesn‚Äôt want to level out. I‚Äôm so tired it‚Äôs not even funny.

I also work night shift on the weekends so that‚Äôs cool. But yeah. I‚Äôm always tired. For many reasons.

Edit to add: 

Everyone has the right/ability to be tired. And one excuse is not necessarily ‚Äúbetter than‚Äù another. Some people get tired faster and it‚Äôs okay. 
I just had wanted to talk about how no matter how much I sleep, I don‚Äôt think I get much rest lol.
